summary:
Hello there!

I'm thrilled to have this opportunity to share a bit about myself with you. I've always been deeply passionate about making a positive impact on education, and it has been an incredibly rewarding journey so far.

Throughout my career, I've faced and conquered complex challenges in the education sector, and I've found great satisfaction in leading and managing teams. Creating an environment where everyone works together harmoniously and contributes their best is something I take immense pride in.

My focus has been in the fascinating world of international education, where I've honed my expertise in educational assessment, operational strategy, and project management. The chance to work on a global scale and connect with diverse individuals from different backgrounds brings me so much joy.

Being fluent in English, Dutch, and Polish has been a significant asset, allowing me to communicate effortlessly in various settings and build strong connections with people from all walks of life.

My academic journey has been enriching, as I pursued a Master's in English Philology from Opole University in Poland, followed by a research-driven Master's in American History. These experiences have fueled my passion for teaching and research, driving me to strive for excellence in all that I do.

One of my greatest strengths lies in implementing effective solutions, and I'm always on the lookout for new opportunities to contribute to the advancement of education worldwide. I thrive in dynamic and challenging environments, as they bring out the best in my problem-solving skills and enable me to drive innovation and sustainable growth.

I'm excited about the prospect of collaborating with like-minded individuals in the pursuit of excellence in education and beyond. If you're interested in exploring potential partnerships or projects, please don't hesitate to reach out. Let's embark on this amazing journey together and make a real difference! I can't wait to connect with you and discover the possibilities ahead.

education.degree_name: Master of Arts in American History (research degree)
Master of Arts in English Philology (taught/research degree)
Bachelor of Arts (Education and Teaching English as a Second Language)

certifications.name: PRINCE2® Foundation certiﬁcate in Project Management
Cambridge Certificate in English Language Teaching to Adults (CELTA)

profile_positions.description:
As the Operations Manager for the Education Office, my primary responsibility is to oversee and manage the growth and success of the operations team. In this role, I play a focal part in ensuring the organization's objectives are met on a cost-effective basis. I meticulously plan, schedule, and review workloads and manpower, optimizing resource allocation to achieve optimal outcomes.
An integral part of my duties involves closely monitoring staffing requirements and actively engaging in the recruitment process. I collaborate with relevant stakeholders to identify specific duties and skill sets required for new hires, ensuring a seamless integration into the team. 
In my pursuit of operational excellence, I am dedicated to enhancing systems, processes, and best practices continually. By aligning these improvements with the organization's objectives, I aim to create an efficient and streamlined operational environment. These procedures are carefully crafted to ensure that cross-programme activities run smoothly and efficiently. 
Promoting effective communication among various departments is a key focus of my role. I prioritize ongoing communication to foster collaboration and create an environment of continuous improvement. This open communication ensures that valuable insights and ideas are shared across teams, driving innovation, and optimizing operational efficiency.
I provide effective team leadership, nurturing a cohesive and motivated operations team that strives for excellence. Performance management is a key aspect of my role, as I guide team members to achieve their full potential and contribute to the organization's success.
Overall, my dedication to driving excellence and efficiency in operations, combined with my strategic acumen and strong focus on meeting organizational goals, enables me to make a meaningful impact on the success and growth of the Education Office.
profile_positions.title: Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
As the Operations Team Lead for the Learning and Teaching Division, I played a central role in coordinating the work of Operations Coordinators. Collaborating closely with Programme Heads, Curriculum Managers, and external stakeholders, I ensured the delivery of appropriate support for various activities and initiatives.
My expertise in analysis, development, and tracking of Learning and Teaching Division metrics enabled me to provide strategic analysis, forecasting, and invaluable support to the academic leadership team.
Throughout my tenure, I led projects with internal staff both within the Learning and Teaching Division and across other divisions like Publishing and Language Services, Professional Development, and School Services. My collaborative approach in project development facilitated seamless coordination of academic products alongside outputs from marketing, communications, and professional development teams.
A key aspect of my role involved providing oversight and support for academic projects, including Standards and Practices, across multiple IB offices and organizational levels, ensuring adherence to budget, schedule, and quality standards.
I remained actively informed about developments in leadership and operations, enabling me to make recommendations for changes in practices and procedures. This commitment to continuous improvement ensured that our tools, team practices, and processes consistently met the mandate and objectives of the Learning and Teaching Division.
As an Operations Team Lead, my skills encompassed project management, strategic analysis, communication, copyright compliance, and interdisciplinary collaboration. My efforts were focused on optimizing operations, driving efficiency, and contributing to the overall success of the Learning and Teaching Division.
profile_positions.title: Operations Team Lead, Learning and Teaching Division

profile_positions.description:
As the Head of Academic Operations, I played a pivotal role in collaborating with Programme Heads to forecast and manage budgets for the 2018-19 fiscal year. Throughout the 2017-18 fiscal year, I provided oversight and efficiently addressed issues alongside the Academic Leadership Team, Finance, and Assessment departments.
A significant aspect of my responsibilities involved providing extensive support for over 40+ curriculum and collaborative meetings, engaging with more than 400 external stakeholders from IB schools worldwide and leading education experts.
To ensure the seamless delivery of programme resources, I coordinated with multiple stakeholders across 7+ departments, including Finance, Legal, Multilingual Publishing Group, Facilities, Communications, Marketing, and Travel.
To facilitate decision-making at the Senior Leadership Team level, I collaborated with the Chief Officer of Learning & Teaching, Programme Heads, and Coordinators on the Quarterly Business Report, reviewing relevant operations-related metrics, and coordinating responses among the Academic Leadership Team.
An integral part of my role was working with Programme Heads and Heads of Operations to identify divisional risks and formulate appropriate mitigation strategies.
In the realm of data management, I acted as the Data Protection Representative, conducting an in-depth analysis of data needs, and collaborating with Legal and IT on transferring data to a new platform and establishing streamlined processes for oversight. 
Throughout my tenure as Head of Academic Operations, I showcased exceptional skills in budget management, stakeholder engagement, project coordination, data analysis, and strategic planning, ensuring seamless operations and successful outcomes for the organization.
profile_positions.title: Head Of Academic Operations (maternity cover)

profile_positions.description:
My role involved collaborating closely with the Languages Area Head and Curriculum Managers to drive the development of the languages and literature curriculum. I demonstrated proficiency in administering and supporting curriculum development initiatives, ensuring smooth and efficient progress.
Effective financial management was a key skill I utilized in my role, as I successfully managed the expenditure of the curriculum review budget, ensuring resources were allocated judiciously and in line with program objectives.
I took charge of organizing and overseeing a number of multi-day meetings with external stakeholders for languages and literature curriculum review. My excellent organizational skills allowed for the smooth execution of these critical meetings.
As part of my responsibilities, I played a vital role in facilitating the production of program materials for languages and literature. My attention to detail and ability to coordinate tasks ensured the timely delivery of high-quality materials.
Handling day-to-day queries from schools on curriculum matters was another essential aspect of my role. I demonstrated strong interpersonal skills and collaborated effectively with Diploma coordinators to address their needs and concerns.
In the course of my work, I established effective working relationships with various divisions and departments within IB, including Travel, Finance, Publishing, Language Services, IT, and Project Management. My ability to collaborate with different teams and stakeholders contributed to the seamless coordination of operations and resources.
Overall, my experience as an Academic Officer for the Diploma Programme honed my skills in curriculum development, financial management, stakeholder engagement, communication, and cross-functional collaboration. My dedication to ensuring the success of the Diploma Programme and effective support for languages and literature laid the foundation for my professional growth and contributions.
profile_positions.title: Academic Officer for the Diploma Programme

company.name: Court Pénale Internationale - International Criminal Court
